snippet: When the F.E.C. staff did its job and sought an investigation of Crossroads GPS, it was blocked by the usual deadlock vote.
abstract: Editorial deplores ability of party politics to stifle Federal Election Commission's role as enforcer of fair election campaigning; cites incident in which FEC recommended investigation into behavior of Crossroads GPS, fund-raising operative of Karl Rove and other Republicans, only to be blocked by partisan vote; says FEC should be scrapped in favor of nonpartisan, independent board capable of decisive action.
lead_paragraph: When the F.E.C. staff did its job and sought an investigation of Crossroads GPS, it was blocked by the usual deadlock vote.

headline.main: Dangerous Inaction by the Election Commission
headline.print_headline: Dangerous Inaction by the Election Commission
